Detailed Description

TagFS filesystem.

Allows a user to browse their files through tags instead of the traditional hierarchical method. Implemented using Filesystem in Userspace (FUSE).

Author:
Keith Woelke
Date:
25/07/2010

Function Documentation

const char* files_from_query ( const char *  path  ) 

Returns a query in the form of a string which will exactly match files within a directory.

It does not match any files in subdirectories nor does it return subdirectory names.

Parameters:
path a string representing a path in the file system.
Returns:
a string representing a query to match files in a given directory.
int num_tags_in_path ( const char *  path  ) 

Counts the number of tags in a path.

Uses the standand path delimiter "/" to calculate the total. Function uses strtok, but does not modify the path that is passed in as a parameter.

Parameters:
path a string representing a path in the file system. const int num_tags_in_path(const char* path);
Returns:
the number of path elements delimited by the "/" character.
bool unique_path ( const char *  tag,
char **  tags_consumed,
int  num_tags_consumed 
)

Checks if a tag has already been used in a path.

It expects to receive a tag, and a list of tags that have already been used. The function then checks to see if the tag in question is contained within the array.

Parameters:
tag the tag to check for uniqueness.
tags_consumed the array of tags that have already been used.
num_tags_consumed the number of tags in the array.
Returns:
true if the tag is not in tags_consumed, false if it is.
bool unique_tags_in_path ( const char *  path  ) 

Calculates whether a path has repeated tags.

If a path has repeated tags, it is not a valid path.

Parameters:
path a string representing a path in the file system.
Returns:
true, if there are no repeated tags. false, if any tags are repeated.
bool valid_path ( const char *  path  ) 

Checks whether or not a given path is valid.

This is specifically done by checking that every component of the path is valid and that every component is unique. Essentially, this is done with calls to valid_tags_in_path and unique_path.

Parameters:
path a string representing a path in the file system.
Returns:
true, if the path is valid. false, if the path is not valid.
bool valid_tags_in_path ( const char *  path  ) 

Checks that the path contains only valid tags.

Tags are considered valid if the exist in the tags table of the database. Essentially, this is done with repeated calls to valid_tag to check each tag in the path for validity.

Parameters:
path a string representing a path in the file system.
Returns:
true, if the path contains unique tags. false, if the path does not contain unique tags.
